newsitem.title: USA: Lehman sees no EPS hit to AOL from refunds.
newsitem.headline: Lehman sees no EPS hit to AOL from refunds.

text.p: Lehman Brothers analyst Brian Oakes reiterated a buy rating on America Online Inc, saying that the company's credit/refund plan to address its subscriber complaints will not have an impact on earnings.

"We estimate a worst-case scenario is that AOL refunds about $16 million -- this will have no impact on our earnings estimates since it will be funded by the $500 million marketing budget," Oakes said in a note to clients.
Wednesday, AOL announced a plan to appease its angry subscribers, who are encountering busy signal problems, by offering refunds or credits of online time, upon request.
Oakes also said that he believes the agreement with the 36 state attorneys general will nullify any of the class action lawsuits that have been filed against AOL.
He also said that because AOL is focusing on its current subscribers and cutting back on its hefty marketing expenses, AOL will transition more quickly into an earnings story.
